creator: pozza.davide@mediamaster.it
text:
If I try to parse an xml buffer longer than 8192 bytes (8k) and that buffer does
not contain newline characters, the SAX parser does not return parsed data
correctly.
Example:
"...<param>mytext</param>..."

If the character 'e' of "mytext" string is on position 8192 of my buffer to parse,
the "public void character(char[]buf, int offset,int len)" method will be
invoked two times for the same tag. The first time, the parameters values will be:
buf="myt";len=3,offset=8190
And the second time:
buf="ext";len=3;offset=1

Regards

Actually, Crimson doesn't have an 'official' Bugzilla database - Edwin has been 
providing support on the general@xml.apache.org mailing list.  But I suppose we 
can hold on to this for the moment.
